instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00923: What is 820-00923? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> super slow.
threads.message:
Good morning, customer dropped coffee and continue using, took the authorized, damaged <CHIP>U5850</CHIP> and its trails. I made all the tracks and replace the component, but it's still slow. In the ASD test it says that the defect is in SMC.
    When you turn on the machine the cooler already turns on and after a while it starts to accelerate, you get

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> super slow.
threads.message:
Run HWMonitor and post strange values you find.

NO ASD available since 2015...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> super slow.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> super slow.
threads.message: <CHIP>U5850</CHIP> this component it is a right temperature sensor ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> super slow.
threads.message:
There looks like Airport Proximity thermal sensor issue.
But this could be normal value, not always considered by SMC.

Inspect <CHIP>U5850</CHIP> area and surrounding components.
Check the other things on page 56 too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> super slow.
threads.message: Sorted out.  The <CHIP>U5850</CHIP> was not touching the tracks.
